translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of the three-factored table of dependent origination, and the text of the three-factored table of dependent origination
The three-factored table of the wholesome, the three-factored table of the determined by wrongness

original: Akusalaṁ micchattaniyataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo namicchattaniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: akusalam micchatta niyatam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na micchatta niyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome, determined-by-wrongness, dhamma as condition, there arises an unwholesome, determined-by-wrongness, dhamma, through kamma-result condition. (In brief.) With respect to root cause, there are three; with respect to predominance, there are three. … With respect to non-hindrance, there are three.

original: Kusalaṁ sammattaniyataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasammattaniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalam sammatta niyatam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sammatta niyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a wholesome, determined-by-rightness, dhamma as condition, there arises a wholesome, determined-by-rightness, dhamma, through root cause condition. (In brief.) With respect to root cause, there are three; with respect to predominance, there are three. … With respect to non-hindrance, there are three.

original: Abyākataṁ aniyataṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naabyākato naaniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: abyākatam aniyatam dhammam paccayā na abyākataḥ na aniyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: With an indeterminate, undetermined, dhamma as condition, there arises an indeterminate, undetermined, dhamma, through root cause condition. (In brief.) With respect to root cause, there are five; … With respect to non-hindrance, there are five.
